segment.source: How to create a custom driver installation script
segment.target: How to create a custom driver installation script

segment.source: If your deployment scenario requires more than installing the driver package on the test computers, you can choose to run your own custom command scripts upon installation.
segment.target: If your deployment scenario requires more than installing the driver package on the test computers, you can choose to run your own custom command scripts upon installation.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Driver package that is test signed and ready to install.
segment.target: Driver package that is test signed and ready to install.

segment.source: You must first create and build your driver and then create a driver package for installation.
segment.target: You must first create and build your driver and then create a driver package for installation.

segment.source: For more information, see Building a Driver and Creating a Driver Package.
segment.target: For more information, see Building a Driver and Creating a Driver Package.

segment.source: Test computers that are configured and provisioned for deployment.
segment.target: Test computers that are configured and provisioned for deployment.

segment.source: See How to test a driver at runtime using Visual Studio.
segment.target: See How to test a driver at runtime using Visual Studio.

segment.source: Instructions
segment.target: Instructions

segment.source: Step 1: To run your own custom command scripts upon installation
segment.target: Step 1: To run your own custom command scripts upon installation

segment.source: From the project property pages for your driver package, you can configure whether you want to automatically deploy a driver package on a test computer.
segment.target: From the project property pages for your driver package, you can configure whether you want to automatically deploy a driver package on a test computer.

segment.source: You can also run a custom installation script from these pages.
segment.target: You can also run a custom installation script from these pages.

segment.source: You can choose to deploy the driver automatically whenever you build the driver solution in each configuration.
segment.target: You can choose to deploy the driver automatically whenever you build the driver solution in each configuration.

segment.source: For more information about deployment, see Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer and Deployment Properties for Driver Projects.
segment.target: For more information about deployment, see Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer and Deployment Properties for Driver Projects.

segment.source: Open the property pages for your driver package project.
segment.target: Open the property pages for your driver package project.

segment.source: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Settings, and then click Deployment.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Settings, and then click Deployment.

segment.source: Click Enable deployment and then select the test computer to use.
segment.target: Click Enable deployment and then select the test computer to use.

segment.source: Click Custom Command Line.
segment.target: Click Custom Command Line.

segment.source: In the box, type custom command scripts that you want to run upon installation.
segment.target: In the box, type custom command scripts that you want to run upon installation.

segment.source: In the Additional Files text box, add the command script and other installation files to be copied to the test computer.
segment.target: In the Additional Files text box, add the command script and other installation files to be copied to the test computer.

segment.source: When the driver is deployed, the additional files are copied to the %Systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder on the remote computer.
segment.target: When the driver is deployed, the additional files are copied to the %Systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder on the remote computer.
